channel.title: Bandwidth Monitor?
channel.description:
In my house there are a few computers, all being used daily. Our 50gb of bandwidth QUICKLY goes, and I'm usually the one ending up paying. I'm getting quite sick of it and I want to do something about it.
What I'm thinking is to install a bandwidth monitor (In Java, as most of the computers are Windows (OOOH the shame:(), and a few Linux.), and then make it send the results to the house server where I can do all sorts of lovely things with it.
All I really need is a quick implementation in Java, with your help, I have NO IDEA when it comes to networking + Java really. Then I can get the program to securely ping the results to the main server.
Thanks:).

item.title: Bandwidth Monitor?
item.dc:creator: @karl1 karl`
item.description:
@karl1 wrote:

o lol ur internet is cheap i got 50gb then capped 8mbit down 384k up and its $250 in australia a month for me!.

Read full topic

item.title: Bandwidth Monitor?
item.dc:creator: @PeeHPee PeeHPee
item.description:
@PeeHPee wrote:

[quote=“communist, post:28, topic:280319”]Yeah.

Is there a SIMPLE way of doing this in c or c+ or something? I mean I just want it to output the current bandwidth usage to the console, then I can manipulate it in Java.[/quote]
Anything Is Possible in C+

Read full topic

item.title: Bandwidth Monitor?
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“communist, post:39, topic:280319”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=370308.msg2802469#msg2802469 date=1243532347]

Your best and almost only solution is to dd-wrt your router, it’s easy and will give you exactly what you want. Just do it and your room mate won’t even know.

I just won’t bother. I’m just gonna search for a REALLY good UK isp with at least 100gb bandwidth, at around £30 per month.

get virgin, no limits per say you just get throttled if you exceed certain limits during times but during night its unlimited 20mbit heaven
[/quote]

No cable or ‘faster’ exchanges here :([/quote]

I know how you feel, highest speed I get is around 400kb/s and I’m paying ~£30/m for internet Theres no cable near me, and im quite a way form any exchange.

Read full topic

item.title: Bandwidth Monitor?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Cheese_Police:

If you want to be able to monitor bandwidth like this you need to make a driver (on Windows). If you ask me it is easiest to just use an old computer and a small switch as a router, and have the monitoring software on that.

Like I said, m0n0wall + switch = solution.

Read full topic

item.title: Bandwidth Monitor?
item.dc:creator: @communist communist
item.description:
@communist wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:23, topic:280319”][quote author=communist link=topic=370308.msg2800403#msg2800403 date=1243354152]
Know of a windows version of “iptables -vnxL” ?
[/quote]

iptables is a linux firewall, windows doesn’t have an equivalent. You would have to find and install some 3rd party firewall, but don’t expect it to be anywhere near as good as iptables.[/quote]

I know, but I mean the bandwidth monitor part.

Read full topic

item.description:
@communist wrote:

item.title: Bandwidth Monitor?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“communist, post:11, topic:280319”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=370308.msg2799156#msg2799156 date=1243265206]

A lot of routers have a bandwidth monitor anyway, that showyou how many pacets etc have been sent from each pc.

I believe you mean managed switches/good routers. Most common ones do not.
[/quote]
QFT. I know FOR SURE my Linksys router doesn’t (No, I’m not installing custom firmware.)[/quote]

Why not install good custom firmware like dd-wrt? With linksys it is as easy as selecting the new file in the router admin panel and clicking ‘upgrade’.

Read full topic
